Key Match Events: Michael Busch belted a pair of home runs en route to a 6-2 victory at Coors Field.
Hendricks became the first Cubs pitcher in the ballpark’s history (since 1995) to allow no more than one run and two hits in a start of at least six innings.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs are five games behind the Mets and Braves for the National League’s third Wild Card slot and desperately try to stay in the hunt.
Post-Match Reflections: Hendricks said that is where his mind is centered, wanting to make this last push and savor the innings he has left this year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs added reliever Festa in a trade with the Rangers.
The North Siders still mathematically in the race with 13 games left on the regular-season schedule.
Others: Hendricks had a 10.57 ERA through his first seven starts, which were interrupted by a stint on the injured list due to a back issue.
Hendricks’ openness to take steps impressed manager Craig Counsell.
